data.title: Delhi Metro: Delhi Metro news. Read latest delhi metro updates & announcements
data.meta_description: Delhi Metro: Read Delhi Metro news on The Economic Times. Latest Delhi metro updates, Delhi Metro announcements, and more.
data.text:
DMRC clocks highest ever passenger journeys on Monday

The previous highest recorded passenger journey count for DMRC stood at 66.19 lakh on February 10, 2020, just before the pandemic struck. This milestone underscores our mission to provide accessible, reliable, and sustainable solutions, DMRC said.

NHAI to undertake safety audit of 29 under-construction tunnels

To move is aimed at ensuring safety and adherence to the highest quality standards during construction and has been triggered by the recent Silkyara tunnel incident in which 41 workers were trapped on November 12.

Over 31 lakh passengers booked QR-code tickets via DMRC app during October 1-November 15

Another 3,41,662 (3.41 lakh) tickets were booked through other digital modes such as WhatsApp in October. The corresponding figure till November 15 stood at 3,97,506 (3.97 lakh), the data showed.

Delhi Metro to run 106 extra trips on Raksha Bandhan

The Delhi Metro will run 106 extra train trips on Raksha Bandhan to accommodate passengers. Additional standby trains will also be available, and extra personnel will be deployed at stations to manage the rush. The DMRC recently achieved a milestone of 68.16 lakh passengers in a day, the highest since the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic. This achievement reflects the trust and resilience of Delhi-NCR residents in the transportation system provided by DMRC. The organization remains committed to passenger safety and comfort while improving connectivity in the region.

Narendra Modi Birthday: Delhi Metro co-passenger wishes PM on his 73rd b'day in Sanskrit, watch!

Prime Minister Narendra Modi travelled in Delhi Metro on September 17. He inaugurated the extension of the Delhi Airport Metro Express line from Dwarka Sector 21 to a new metro station, ‘YashoBhoomi Dwarka Sector 25’. A co-passenger wished PM Modi on his 73rd birthday in Sanskrit. Watch the video!Narendra Modi Birthday: Delhi Metro co-passenger wishes PM on his 73rd b'day in Sanskrit, watch!

Trains on Airport Line to run at 120 kmph from Sunday: DMRC

Trains on the Airport Line of the Delhi Metro in India will now run at a speed of 120 kmph, an increase from the previous speed of 90 kmph. This increase was made possible through careful planning and implementation by engineers from the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC), in consultation with government agencies and experts. The increase in speed will result in reduced travel times, with the journey between New Delhi and Dwarka Sector 21 now taking around 19 minutes instead of 22.

Delhi Metro in news again for wrong reasons, video of women fighting goes viral

This isn't the first such incident reported on the Delhi Metro; earlier in the year, videos of couples kissing and dancing vloggers made headlines, culminating in a man being filmed masturbating on a train, leading to police intervention to curb such behavior. Social media users have suggested that the Delhi Metro monetizes such videos.

Delhi Metro viral video: Woman scolds couple engaging in PDA

A video showing a woman confronting a couple engaging in public displays of affection (PDA) inside the Delhi Metro has sparked a debate about the boundaries of expressing affection in public spaces. The woman advised the couple to reserve such behavior for more private settings, while others argue that there should be limits to such displays for the comfort of others.

G20 Summit: Delhi Metro Authority requests commuters to use Magenta line to reach Airport Terminal 1

As per the DMRC statement, "To reach Terminal 1 of IGI Airport, commuters are requested to use Magenta Line and get down at Terminal 1-IGI Airport Metro Station. Feeder Buses between Delhi Aerocity Station of Airport Line and Terminal 1 will be unavailable from 8th to 10th September."

Delhi Metro: Airport Line extension to be opened for passengers today

The journey from New Delhi Metro Station to the newly-built YashoBhoomi Dwarka Sector 25 station will take about 21 minutes. This extension will enhance urban connectivity in the sub-city and provide metro connectivity to residents in the Dwarka and Gurugram areas. The Delhi Metro network will now be 393 km-long with 288 stations.

G20 Summit: Delhi Traffic Police revises previous order on metro services. Here's all you need to know

Delhi Traffic Police has revised its earlier decision to close multiple metro station gates during the G20 Summit in the city. Services will now only be affected at the Supreme Court station, while all other stations will continue to operate. Entry and exit may be temporarily closed at some stations for 10-15 minutes due to security measures

Delhi Metro services to start early on I-Day, no parking at stations

Parking facilities will not be available at all the Delhi Metro stations from 6 am on Monday till 2 pm on Tuesday in view of the security measures taken for the 77th Independence Day celebrations, the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) said in a statement. The trains will run with a frequency of 30 minutes on all the metro lines till 6 am, after which the trains will run as per the normal timetable throughout the day, it added.

Delhi Metro records highest-ever footfall on August 29

The Delhi Metro has broken its own record for daily passenger journeys, with 69.94 lakh journeys on August 29, surpassing the previous record of 68.16 lakh on August 28. The Red Line accounted for 7,65,059 journeys, Yellow Line - 19,11,239, Blue Line - 14,90,171, and Airport Express Line - 61,041. The previous highest count was 66,18,717 before the pandemic disrupted travel patterns.

Two of three remaining corridors of Delhi Metro's Phase-IV in advanced stages of approval: Official

In March 2019, the Union Cabinet approved three out of the six corridors of the Delhi Metro's Phase-IV, which will further improve connectivity in the national capital. The remaining three proposed corridors which have not yet been approved are Rithala-Bawana-Narela, Inderlok-Indraprastha and Lajpat Nagar-Saket G Block.

Ahead of G20 Summit, pro-Khalistan messages found written on Delhi Metro property

A senior Delhi Metro Rail Corporation official said, "It is a law and order situation. We will cooperate with the Delhi Police." The alleged action comes ahead of the G20 Summit on September 9-10.

Alcohol now allowed in Delhi Metro

The Delhi Metro has revised its rules to allow passengers to carry two sealed bottles of alcohol per person. However, drinking alcohol inside the metro premises remains strictly prohibited. The revised rules are applicable to all metro lines, in line with the provisions on the Airport Express Line.

US Ambassador Eric Garcetti rides Delhi Metro, emphasizes US-India tech collaboration

US Ambassador Eric Garcetti took a ride on the Delhi Metro's Magenta Line, engaging with passengers and praising the efficiency of the metro system. The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation shared images of the ambassador's commute on social media. Garcetti also spoke at a tech conference, highlighting collaborative efforts between the US and India in technology and healthcare. He mentioned a project funded by USAID that detects tuberculosis through a smartphone app and a vaccine for dengue fever developed by Indian companies.

WhatsApp-based ticketing system expanded to all lines of Delhi Metro

It was first launched on the Airport Express Line in June. DMRC has now extended this service to all lines in Delhi-NCR, as well as the Gurugram Rapid Metro in collaboration with Meta and their authorized partner, Pelocal Fintech Pvt. Ltd.

How to buy Delhi Metro QR paperless online ticket on DMRC Travel app

DMRC has launched the 'DMRC TRAVEL' app, allowing users to purchase paperless online mobile QR tickets for travelling across its network in Delhi and NCR. Passengers can download the app, register, buy tickets, and scan them at the gate directly from their phones. The app supports multiple payment methods and offers additional features such as a travel planner, fare calculator, and smart card recharge.

Instagram vlogger attempts stunt reel on Delhi Metro; gets trolled online

Adding to the growing collection of audacious clips, another video showcases Kanojiya dancing to Himesh Reshammiya's 'Tu Yaad Na Aaye Aisa Koi Din Nahi,' entertaining a female passenger whose relationship to her remains shrouded in mystery. While many passengers on the Delhi Metro have seemingly become desensitized to such incidents, the online community is expressing a mix of amusement, flooding the reels with humorous comments, and venting their mounting frustration.

Delhi Metro: 44,186 trees felled, 7,923 transplanted since Phase 1 work began in 1998

During the construction of Phase 1, which commenced in 1998 and concluded in 2005, the DMRC cut down 13,858 trees and transplanted 3,584 trees. Phase 1 involved the creation of a 65-kilometre-long rail network comprising 59 stations.In Phase 2, carried out between 2005 and 2011, the DMRC axed 17,997 trees and transplanted 3,052 trees. The construction of Phase 2 encompassed a 125-km-long rail network with 89 stations.

Viral video captures intense fight in Delhi Metro, sparks concern over commuter behavior

As the scuffle unfolded, fellow commuters within the metro coach intervened, attempting to mediate and separate the two brawlers. However, their efforts to defuse the situation were met with resistance from the agitated individuals. This event is merely the latest in a string of peculiar incidents that have transpired on the Delhi Metro, including couples engaging in public displays of affection, individuals creating social media content, and other objectionable behavior.

Making reels in Delhi Metro? DMRC says no

In a statement, the DMRC had said it "expects commuters to behave responsibly while using the Delhi Metro and follow all social etiquette and protocols which are acceptable in the society". "Commuters should not indulge in any indecent/obscene activity that may cause discomfort or could offend the sensibilities of other fellow commuters. DMRC's Operations and Maintenance Act in fact lists out indecency as a punishable offence under Section 59," it said.

Mall on wheels? Inside Delhi Metro's plan to let you shop on the go

Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) is launching a virtual shopping app this July. The app, called Momentum 2.0, will enable commuters to purchase various stuff and collect their orders from their destination stations. What is more, commuters will also be able to make bookings for last-mile connectivity on the app.

Yashobhoomi, India's largest exhibition center, to open in Oct, hold over 200 events in 2 years

Yashobhoomi conference complex in Dwarka is set to open in October, with a Korean operator managing the exhibition halls and convention center. The complex, spanning 221 acres and costing Rs 25,000 crore, will host over 100 exhibitions and conventions in the next two years. The first phase includes two exhibition halls, a convention center for 11,000 people, and an underground parking facility for 3,000 cars.

Battleground Delhi Metro: Two women engage in ugly fight inside the metro

The video start with one of the women brandishing her shoe while the other woman prepares herself for an apparent fight by setting aside her phone. Other ladies passengers in the ladies' compartment can be heard asking them to stop and refrain from resorting to violence. As arguments escalated, the verbal exchange turns into a barrage of abuses, and one woman was also seen throwing water on the other.​​​​

Delhi Metro tests out QR-based ticket system; set to launch it by June-end

Nevertheless, DMRC remains committed to enhancing the technology and resolving any challenges encountered during the trial phase. The ultimate aim is to streamline ticketing processes and provide a user-friendly experience for Metro passengers, thereby enhancing the overall commuting experience in Delhi.

AAP slams PM Modi for not inviting CM Kejriwal for Delhi Metro Airport Line inauguration

Aam Admi Party hit out at Prime Minister Narendra Modi for not sending an invitation to Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal for the inauguration of the Delhi Airport Metro Express line.AAP slams PM Modi for not inviting CM Kejriwal for Delhi Metro Airport Line inauguration

Metro trains now running at 120 kmph on Airport Line: DMRC official

Delhi Metro had increased the operational speed of its trains on the Airport Express Line from 90 kmph to 100 kmph on March 22 this year, the officials said. The speed of the trains was further increased to 110 kmph on June 22, which was in turn increased to 120 kmph on Sunday. The safety certification for the speed increase has already been received earlier this month, the DMRC said.

Case registered after Delhi metro stations defaced with pro-Khalistan slogans

Several metro stations in Delhi have been defaced with pro-Khalistan slogans, leading to a case being registered by the police. The defacement comes ahead of the G20 Summit, which is set to be hosted in Delhi next month. The case has been registered under sections 153 A, section 505 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) and Defacement Act. Suspected activists of Sikhs For Justice (SFJ), a separatist group, are believed to be responsible for the defacement.

All you need to know before travelling in Delhi NCR amid G20 Summit

The G20 Summit will take place in Delhi, India on September 9th and 10th. The main venue for the summit will be Bharat Mandapam, Pragati Maidan, with additional visits planned to Rajghat, NGMA, and IARI. To ensure smooth traffic flow, the Delhi govt has issued traffic restrictions.All you need to know before travelling in Delhi NCR amid G20 Summit

Delhi Metro extends UPI payment facility across entire network

The Delhi Metro has extended the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) option for payments at ticket vending machines and counters across its network, streamlining ticketing services and providing a digital mode of travel. Passengers can recharge their smart cards or purchase metro QR tickets through UPI-supported mobile apps.

Delhi Metro introduces QR code paper tickets, tokens to be phased out. How the new system works

Delhi Metro said that Iwo automatic fare collection gates, each for entry and exit, at stations have been upgraded for travel by QR based paper tickets. By the end of June it aims to make all the fare collection gates QR code-compliant along with upgradation of Ticket Vending Machines (TVMs) for issuing of QR based paper tickets.

These Delhi metro station gates to be shut down from September 8–10 due to G20 Summit

Delhi Police's metro unit will close the gates of 39 metro stations that open towards the VVIPs Route during the G20 Summit in the national capital from September 8 to 10. Certain stations including Supreme Court, Janpath, Bhikaji Cama Place, Khan Market, and Dhaula Kuan have been designated as 'Sensitive' stations.

Delhi Metro offers ‘Tourist Smart Cards’ for G20 delegates for hassle-free travel

Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) will commence the selling of its ‘Tourist Smart Cards’ from selected Metro stations on Monday. the cards will be sold through dedicated counters for a period of ten days i.e. from September 04, 2023 to September 13, 2023. The move aims at facilitating the G-20 delegates and international visitors who might be interested in exploring the prominent tourist places of the national capital, owing to the upcoming G20 Summit. Delhi Metro offers ‘Tourist Smart Cards’ for G20 delegates for hassle-free travel

G20: Delhi Metro to sell 'Tourist Smart Cards' through dedicated counters from September 4-13

Delhi Metro will sell 'Tourist Smart Cards' through dedicated counters at 36 stations from September 4-13 to accommodate increased passenger footfall during the G20 Summit. The cards, available in one-day and three-day validity, offer unlimited rides on the metro network.

Delhi based researcher breaks Guinness World Record for fastest trip on Delhi Metro

​​Employing a shrewd strategy, he acquired a "one-day tourist card" from the conveniently located Delhi Metro stations to facilitate his monumental journey. With a prompt commencement at 8:30 AM, Shashank embarked on the Blue Line, traversing more than 348 km before reaching his final destination at Brigadier Hoshiar Singh Station on the Green Line.

India gets ready to dish out lavish hospitality at G20 Summit

New Delhi is preparing to host the G20 summit on September 8-10, with a focus on showcasing the best of Indian culture and cuisine. The city is being spruced up for the event, with educational institutes and offices closed and traffic restrictions in place. Spouses of G20 leaders will be taken on tours of Delhi's prominent monuments, and special shopping arrangements are being made.

Man records and posts video of couple sitting together in Delhi metro, calls them 'awkward', other users school him

While riding on the Delhi Metro, a man recorded a couple who were sitting together and subsequently uploaded the video to Twitter, mentioning both the Delhi Metro DCP and the official Delhi Metro handle. In the tweet, he mentioned that he is feeling "awkward".

Delhi Police detains two in connection with pro-Khalistan graffiti at metro stations ahead of G20 meet

In a major breakthrough, Delhi Police Special Cell on August 31 apprehended two persons accused from Punjab in connection with pro-Khalistan graffiti and slogans painted at more than five metro stations in Delhi on August 27. Further investigation is being conducted by the police.Delhi Police detains two in connection with pro-Khalistan graffiti at metro stations ahead of G20 meet

Operational speed of metro trains on Airport Express Line increased to 110 KMPH: DMRC

The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has increased the speed of metro trains from 100 kmph to 110 kmph on the 23-km-long Airport Express Line (AEL), connecting New Delhi to Dwarka Sec-21 via IGI Airport after receiving approval from the Commissioner of Metro Rail Safety (CMRS). The travel time from New Delhi to Airport (T-3) station has been reduced to 16 minutes, while Rajiv Chowk is accessible in 15 minutes.

G20 summit: Several Delhi Metro stations defaced with pro-Khalistan slogans; case registered

Ahead of the G20 Summit, pro-Khalistan messages were found in at least five Delhi Metro stations, officials said on Sunday. A senior police officer said unidentified people wrote "Delhi Banega Khalistan" and "Khalistan Zindabad" on the walls of the metro stations. Police sources identified the stations as Shivaji Park, Madipur, Paschim Vihar, Udyog Nagar, and Maharaja Surajmal Stadium. A wall of a government school in Nangloi was also found defaced.G20 summit: Several Delhi Metro stations defaced with pro-Khalistan slogans; case registered

Delhi Metro's Yellow Line sees service delays and overcrowded stations; Hilarious memes flood social media

Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) took to Twitter to inform commuters of the service disruptions that were experienced on the Yellow Line. Commuters traveling between Kashmere Gate and Central Secretariat were advised to utilize the Violet Line for their commute.

G20 Summit: Bus movement to be restricted, use metro in Lutyens' Delhi, advise Delhi Police

The Delhi Traffic Police has advised people to use the metro for commuting during the two days of the G20 Summit, as bus movement will be restricted in the Lutyens' Delhi area where the summit will be held. A virtual helpdesk will be launched on the Delhi Police website to provide information on available transport facilities and nearby medical facilities.

India will have world’s second-largest metro system, says Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri

Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on August 21 hailed Delhi Metro and talked about its future prospects. He said that India will soon have world’s second largest metro system.India will have world’s second-largest metro system, says Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri

Over 7.4 million QR Code tickets sold, token sales drop: Delhi Metro

The urban transporter hopes that commuters will gradually start using fewer physical tokens after the launch of this service. But many passengers have complained about technical issues faced at AFC (automatic fare collection) gates while using QR code-based paper tickets.

Make taking the metro cool again

After electricity, the transport sector accounts for a sizeable portion of the country's emissions, around 14% and rising. However, this segment also offers those willing to align their activities with a lower environmental footprint an opportunity to act.

DMRC to make passengers aware about CO2 emissions reduction due to Metro travel

The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has launched a "CarbonLite Metro Travel" initiative for passengers to know how much carbon emissions they have saved while using the metro instead of petrol-fueled cars. "CarbonLite Metro Travel" was supported by research from The Energy and Resources Institute (TERI), Delhi, that each kilometer travelled by metro train instead of road vehicles “results in a noteworthy reduction of 32.38 grams of CO2 emissions”.

DMRC to operate, maintain Mumbai Metro's Line 3, city's first fully underground corridor

The DMRC will be responsible for the day-to-day operations of the metro line, including management of operation control centre, depot control centre, stations, running trains, maintenance of trains and all metro systems infrastructure, and ensuring the safety of passengers, the release said.

Video of a man brushing his teeth inside a Delhi Metro train goes viral

The video was posted by one Mohit Gauhar on his Instagram account. It has now gone viral with over 81,000 likes and over a million views.

Withdraw order allowing commuters to carry liquor in trains: Traders' body to DMRC

The Chamber of Trade and Industry, in a statement, alleged that anti-social activities will increase if liquor is permitted to be carried inside trains and said that a delegation of the traders' body will meet DMRC chief Vikas Kumar to discuss the issue.

Delhi Metro coaches to be patrolled by police, DMRC staff after row over viral videos

The DMRC has requested commuters to report such incidents to the nearest available metro staff/CISF immediately so that appropriate action can be taken. The CISF is tasked with guarding the Delhi metro premises and responding to any situation inside coaches. A dedicated Delhi Metro Rail Police is also present to deal with any untoward activity.

Delhi Excise dept seeks change in norm of carrying two liquor bottles in Metro trains

A DMRC statement said the decision on what items are permitted for carriage on the Delhi Metro is based upon permissibility by the security agency in charge of handling the same for the Corporation. "Passengers are expected to follow extant rules and regulations of the concerned state excise department with regard to carrying liquor during cross-border transit," the DMRC said.

'Passenger bane, Pareshani nahi': Filming Insta Reels, dance videos are banned in Delhi Metro, says DMRC

"Filming reels, dance videos or any other such activities that may cause inconvenience to the passengers is strictly prohibited inside the Delhi Metro," Delhi Metro Rail Corporation reiterated in a release. DMRC posted a tweet urging travellers to not cause trouble for other passangers. "Travel, don't cause trouble," DMRC tweeted.

No dance or reels: Your fellow passenger in Delhi Metro could be police in civil clothes

In view of some objectionable incidents on Delhi Metro coaches, DMRC may deploy police personnel in civil coaches in coaches, reports say. ​The DMRC had said it will intensify the deployment of flying squads in the metro.

Woman attacks co-passenger with pepper spray on Delhi Metro. Video goes viral

The video went viral after it was posted and has been viewed over 500,000 times. In the video, the two women on Delhi Metro were seen yelling at each other and it was not clear what started the quarrel.

Delhi flood: Metro trains crossing bridges with restricted speed, Yamuna bank metro station closed

Delhi metro has temporarily closed Yamuna Bank station and reduced train speed on four Yamuna bridges due to rising river levels. The river has passed its danger mark, flooding low-lying areas. The station is inaccessible due to the escalating river levels, the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation has said. Vehicular movement across several Delhi roads has also been disrupted.

Delhi rains: 13 locations waterlogged, Pragati Maidan tunnel closed temporarily

Heavy rains led to waterlogging and extensive traffic congestion in several parts of New Delhi on Monday. Thirteen locations in the city were affected by waterlogging, including areas such as Boulevard Road, Tikri Kalan, and Gazipur Dairy Farm. Collapse of a tree was reported from Hemkunt Colony, GK-I, and a road caved in on Ramdev Chowk to Sabzi Mandi Carriageway

PM Modi engaged in lively conversation with us, his aura was inviting: Student who interacted with him in Delhi Metro

Prime Minister Narendra Modi engaged in a very "lively conversation" with students while travelling in a metro train to attend a centenary function of Delhi University on Friday and he talked about the role of the youth in nation-building, a student who interacted with him said.

Delhi Metro services to be curtailed on Airport Line Sunday for maintenance

Trains will run on a single line between Dhaula Kuan and Airport (T-3) metro stations when the maintenance is underway on the other track. Normal train movement will be maintained from Airport to Dwarka-21 and Dhaula Kuan to New Delhi sections, the DMRC said in a statement Friday. Due to this, trains will be available with increased headway on the Airport Express Line originating from both ends, officials said.

PM Narendra Modi travels in metro to attend Delhi University event

On Friday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi surprised commuters and university students alike as he hopped onto the metro to attend the valedictory function of Delhi University's centenary celebrations. The PM's decision to use public transportation was met with widespread appreciation as officials shared pictures of Modi sitting with commuters and engaging in conversations during the journey.

Delhi Metro Holi update: One section on Yellow Line to remain closed for whole day but other routes open from 2:30 pm

Delhi Metro Yellow Line update: Services on one section between Rajiv Chowk and Central Secretariat on will remain closed for the whole day today (8th March 2023) for scheduled maintenance work. On other sections, metro services will start services from 2:30 pm today due to Holi.

Video of woman dancing on the Delhi Metro platform goes viral

The new video comes days after video of a scantily clad woman travelling in a Delhi Metro coach surfaced. Incidentally, DMRC had on several occassions warned passengers against making insta reels or dance videos inside Delhi metro, saying they would be fined if caught doing so.

Chaos in Delhi Metro: Two men fight and threaten each other over a seat inside the metro. See video here

The video surfaced just a few days after the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) issued a statement urging passengers to observe social etiquette when using public transportation.

IPL 2023: Delhi Metro extends last train timings amid IPL fever; Here are the changed timings

Amid the ongoing IPL fever which is a whole celebration for all cricket lovers, the Delhi Metro Rail Corp (DMRC) has extended the timings of last trains.

Delhi Metro to monitor real-time condition of buildings during tunnelling work

​​ The stretch between Derawal Nagar and Pulbangash will comprise three underground metro stations -- Derawal Nagar, Ghanta Ghar, and Pulbangash. These areas are extremely congested and there are innumerable buildings which are "centuries-old, and some are not in very good condition", they said.

Delhi Metro deploys fully indigenously built signalling system, a boost to Atmanirbhar Bharat

The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation, on Saturday, launched India's first ever Indigenously developed Train Control & Supervision System. The first deployment of the I-ATS or the Indigenous Automatic Train Supervision will be on Delhi Metro's Red Line -- from Rithala to Shaheed Sthal.Delhi Metro deploys fully indigenously built signalling system, a boost to Atmanirbhar Bharat

G20 Summit: Delhi police requests Delhi Metro to begin services from 4 am on Sept 8-10

Delhi's Commissioner of Police, Sanjay Arora, has requested the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) to start metro services from 4:00 am on September 8, 9, and 10, during the G20 Summit. This request aims to facilitate the commute of the 40,000 personnel involved in maintaining law and order during the summit.

Now you can buy Delhi Airport Express line Metro tickets through WhatsApp

Delhi Metro Rail Corporation, DMRC, has launched new commuter services for using Airport Express Line. People can now buy tickets through the WhatsApp chatbot with one click of their smartphones. In addition, the system allows commuters to receive a QR code-based ticket directly on the chatting app.Now you can buy Delhi Airport Express line Metro tickets through WhatsApp

How to avail WhatsApp-based ticketing service on Airport Express Line metro

Delhi Metro Rail Corporation or DMRC has launched new services for the commuters using Airport Express Line. People can now buy tickets through WhatsApp chatbot from one-click of their smartphones. The system allows commuters to receive a QR code-based ticket directly on the chatting app.

New parliament building inauguration: Entry, exit gates of two metro stations in Delhi closed

"As per directions received from the Delhi Metro Rail Police, all entry and exit gates of Central Secretariat and Udyog Bhawan stations have been closed for passenger movement," the Delhi Metro Railway Corporation tweeted around 8:30 am.
